text1: With social technologies becoming a given for organizations, more companies have started to integrate various social media platforms to connect and engage with their employees and the public. Social media has become a powerful marketing tool for brand managers because of its interactive nature.
text2: Social media is a great way for a potential employee to gain more insight into the work environment and how the company wishes to progress via the social media page of the company.

text1: During the COVID-19 pandemic, repeated & detailed content about the virus, geographical statistics, and multiple sources of information led to chronic stress & confusion amongst the masses
text2: The misinformation circulating on social media during the pandemic, became a threat to the public health, as some posts promoted medicines which had not been deemed safe for COVID-19 treatment, while others encouraged individuals to refuse a COVID-19 vaccination. This added another significant obstacle in the way of containing an already chaotic & deadly pandemic.

text1: Social media is not only used by jobs & businesses but is also widely used by students in learning environments (especially during the pandemic). It has increased college students' satisfaction and rate of collaboration.

They can also write blogs for teachers as well as for themselves to supplement their knowledge.  However, if not kept in check it can become a major distraction from their education and studies.

text1: Social platforms help us make connections. For some, this may boost their morale, strengthen the relationships with their friends & family and may even inspire them, seeing the works of others. On the other hand, excessive use of social media may fuel feelings like anxiety, depression, isolation, etc.
text2: High social media usage can result in lower interaction and isolation from family, friends, & co-workers. For children, exposure to inappropriate content like violence and pornography is highly likely without the use of monitoring and parental control applications.

text1: There are many ways consumers come to an informed decision before buying a product, such as Reddit forums, Instagram posts, and influencers on Twitter and Facebook. text2: From the results, it is apparent that, on average, social media plays a vital role in influencing buying decisions and giving consumers quality information to make an informed purchase.

text1: Some of the ads and marketing on social media which appear innocent are the key to cybercrimes such as financial frauds & identity theft, which rely on social engineering and a user clicking on a malicious link. Slowly & steadily these cybercrimes have found their way into the online lives of people & victims of these cyber-crimes suffer financially & mentally.
text2: While cybersecurity experts are working day and night to ensure that the online experience stays safe for most of the users, it is not enough. We, the  consumers of social media need to be wary of different ways in which a bad actor could try to cause us financial, emotional or any other kind of harm via social engineering, phishing or other causes.

text1: social media has a profound effect on elections. Often, social media compounds with the mass media networks (such as cable television), by taking its messages and amplifying/reinforcing propagandas, resulting in partisan divides and polarization.
text2: The US political scene is a good example of the impact social media has on politics. The active presence of national politicians and IT cells of political parties on platforms supports this argument. The US Capitol Riots were also a good example of how social media was used to incite violence amongst the masses to spread political propaganda.

text1: Social media has also grown to have a substantial impact on film and TV. People don’t go to cinemas; they watch YouTube or Netflix. They don’t buy albums; they stream music for free or from Spotify/Hotstar. They prefer to consume content in bite-sized nuggets over long continuous media. A funny 2-minute TikTok gets more views than a 2-hour movie.
text2: People share their experiences of going to events and watching movies and TV shows on social media, which can tell us a lot about what is popular currently. These online conversations breach international boundaries and can truly represent a global opinion. But more importantly, these connections can influence another person’s behavior.

text1: One of the best benefits of social media is it allows people to easily stay connected through messaging, video chats, or photographs. Social media also provides so many platforms to express feelings, thoughts, and opinions. It’s a great way to explore and learn more about various interests and stay informed about current events
text2: Along with the benefits of social media, risks and negative consequences can arise as well. Too much social media use can result in lower interaction with people in real life and inappropriate behavior such as bullying, slander, or sending/posting risky pictures can happen because a social media user has a false sense of security behind the screen.  Often people don’t consider that their digital footprint can last forever.
